content: one front and back repeat row 3 and 4 until shawl is the desired size and sufficient yarn remains for a picot bind-off ending with row 4 the picot bind-off requires significantly more yarn than a regular bind off would use picot bind-off *cast on 2 stitches with knitting on cast-on bind off 4 stitches slip_stitch from right hand needle back to left hand needle * repeat between *ʼs until all stitches have been bound off soak and block according to your preference © 2014 carolyn glauz-todrank all rights reserved for personal noncommercial use only though this pattern is simple please honor my copyright and do not reproduce for sale
